title: The hit error meter scale
description: The scale factor of the hit error meter. Must be a number between 0.5 and 5.

title: The Unstable Rate display scale
description: The scale factor of the Unstable Rate display. Must be a number between 0.5 and 5.

title: Automatically hide the in-game hit error meter
description: Automatically hide the in-game hit error meter. Useful for people, who want to both see the in-game hit error meter, and use this overlay somewhere else. !!! IMPORTANT !!! If this is enabled, the overlay MUST BE at the exact bottom center of the screen.

title: Show the hit error meter in osu!catch
description: By default, osu!catch uses the hit error array to store where the fruit landed on the catcher's plate relative to their center, which is probably not that useful for most people. This option is for anyone that wants to see the hit error meter in osu!catch anyway.

title: Show hit windows
description: Show hit windows of the hit error meter. The equivalent of this being toggled off can be seen in some VSRGs out there.

title: Show the moving average arrow
description: Show the moving average arrow on top of the hit error meter.

title: Show the Unstable Rate display
description: Show Unstable Rate display alongside the hit error meter. Note: By enabling this option, it will also show the Unstable Rate when playing osu!catch, however it will be in the context of fruits falling onto the catcher's plate relative to the catcher's center.

title: 320's hit window colo(u)r
description: The colo(u)r used for 320's hit windows. Note: this only affects osu!mania.

title: 300's hit window colo(u)r
description: The colo(u)r used for 300's hit windows.

title: 200's hit window colo(u)r
description: The colo(u)r used for 200's hit windows. Note: this only affects osu!mania.

title: 100's hit window colo(u)r
description: The colo(u)r used for 100's hit windows.

title: 50's hit window colo(u)r
description: The colo(u)r used for 50's hit windows.

title: The height of the main tick (in pixels)
description: The height of the main tick that always sits in the center, dividing the hit error meter into "early" and "late" segments. Must be a number bigger or equal 6.

title: The height of hit error ticks (in px)
description: The height of hit error ticks in the hit error meter when their animation is complete. Must be a number bigger or equal 6.

title: The width of hit error ticks (in px)
description: The width of hit error ticks in the hit error meter. Must be a number between 1 and 8.

title: The width multiplier of hit windows
description: The width multiplier of hit error meter segments. Must be a number between 0.5 and 5.
